Package game.entities

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.entities.Entity
      • game.entities.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    K, Printable
    public class Player
extends Entity
implements K
    This class represents a player-entity with which the user navigates through the game layout and engages in battles with.

    • Method Detail

      • printPlayerInfo

        public void printPlayerInfo​(String title,
                            boolean treasuresIncluded)
        Prints a box with player information such as player name, HP, max damage and total monsters killed. Prints out player's treasures and their value also if the option for printing treasures is checked.

        The method determines its width by comparing all the rows of text, which are to be contained inside the box and finds the row with the biggest length. This length becomes the value used to determine how wide the printed box will be.

        Parameters:
        title - The title printed out on the title row in the box.
        treasuresIncluded - Option to also print player's treasures, their values and the total value inside the printed box. true to print the treasures false to not do that.

      • formatRow

        private String formatRow​(String content)
        Formats the given content into a row by prefixing it with a vertical bar.
        Parameters:
        content - The content to format as a row in the box.
        Returns:
        A formatted string representing a row in the box.

      • addTreasureInfo

        private void addTreasureInfo​(List<String> rows)
        Adds information about the player's treasures to the list of rows. This includes each treasure's name and value, and optionally the total value.
        Parameters:
        rows - The list of rows to which treasure information will be added.

      • calculateMaxWidth

        private int calculateMaxWidth​(List<String> rows)
        Calculates the maximum width required for the box based on the length of the longest row.
        Parameters:
        rows - The list of rows to be displayed inside the box.
        Returns:
        The maximum width required for the box.

      • printBox

        public void printBox​(List<String> rows,
                     int boxWidth)
        Prints a box around the provided rows of text, adjusting the width to the widest row. The box is printed with '+' at the corners and '-' for the horizontal lines.
        Parameters:
        rows - The rows of text to enclose in the box.
        boxWidth - The calculated width of the box to ensure all text fits.

      • printPlayerInfo

        public void printPlayerInfo​(String title)
        Overloaded method to print player information without including treasures by default.
        Parameters:
        title - The title printed out on the title row in the box.

      • getTreasuresTotalValue

        public int getTreasuresTotalValue()
        Returns:
        Total value of all player's treasures.

      • addTreasure

        public void addTreasure​(Treasure treasure)
        Parameters:
        treasure - Treasure to be added to the player's treasure array.

      • addMonsterKilled

        public void addMonsterKilled()
        Increment the total amount of monsters killed by one.

      • printObject

        public void printObject()
        An empty implementation of the printObject method from the base class. Intended to be overridden by subclasses if specific print functionality is needed.
        Specified by:
        printObject in interface Printable
